title: Legal Manager Job at Human Capital Group
content:
Human Capital Group, a Financial Leasing Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Legal Manager
Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify and manage group legal risks
	Provide legal advice on the company’s transaction and other matters concerning the company
	Manage the group companies’ relationships with external solicitors and ensure that the group is properly represented in all litigations concerning it.
	Provide statutory Company Secretarial services and act as Secretary to the Board of Directors and all standing committees of the group
	Provide advice on, interpret, and communicate all legal issues, opinions, laws, rules, guidelines statutes, especially as regards Group businesses, to staff and management
	Provide firm but fair opinions on all legal matters to the company
	Review, and draft MOUs, legal agreements, and security documentation between the group and external parties: and among the individual companies in the group
	Liaise with legal departments of external organizations
	Liaise with government agencies for the smooth running of the group (such as filing of papers at CAC etc.).
	Continuously monitor compliance with statutory obligations and advise management accordingly.
	Mentor Staff of the Legal department, Lead and mentor the legal team, fostering a culture of excellence and collaboration.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Law (LLB).
	A minimum of 8 years of legal experience, with at least 4 years in a leadership role.
	Exceptional contract negotiation and drafting skills.
	Proven experience managing litigation and regulatory matters.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to influence and build relationships at all levels.
	Demonstrated leadership and team management experience.


Salary
N400,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humancapitalgroupng@gmail.com using "Legal Manager" as the subject of the mail.

title: Content Creator Job at BlueBrain Services Limited
content:
BlueBrain Services Limited is a human resources services, capacity building, and development project management consulting firm managed by experienced corporate professionals in human resources management, financial services, project management, business development, capacity building, and knowledge management. We offer bespoke solutions and recent innovations to our clients in a bid to make them go ahead of their competition.
We aim to become one of the top five financial consulting firms in the country.

Our ambition is to deliver quality support services to private and public sector organizations, especially in specialized areas supporting decision-making from operational results.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Content Creators will update content for the organisation website and engage customers using the social media platform.


Job Description


	Writing, reviewing, editing, and updating content for company websites, blogs, marketing materials, and similar platforms.
	Conducting research and interviews to learn more about current trends, developments, and perceptions about the subject matter, and then contextualizing your findings.
	Assisting the creative team with the design of promotional materials.
	Using social media to engage consumers, respond to questions or complaints, and to promote company initiatives.
	Collaborating with internal departments to establish campaign objectives, complete tasks, and identify and solve problems.
	Monitoring social media and company website metrics.
	Excellent writing and editing skills.
	Ability to create engaging and compelling content.
	Knowledge of SEO and content marketing strategies.
	Utilizing SEO methods to increase site traffic.
	Suggesting new ways to promote company offerings and to reach consumers.
	Be able to create content, and use electronic gadgets.
	Experience with content management systems.
	Develop content strategies, script for documentaries.
	Create and publish engaging content for various platforms such as website, social media, blog, etc.
	Develop content that encourages community interaction, such as Q&A sessions, polls, challenges, live streams and webinars.
	Conduct research to stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices.
	Collaborate with other teams such as marketing and design to create content that aligns with the company’s goals and brand identity.
	Optimize content for search engines and social media platforms to increase visibility and reach.
	Analyze content performance metrics such as views, engagement, and conversion rates to inform future content strategies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mass Communication, Journalism or any related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in the role.
	Experience in Agribusiness or farming-related field will be highly recommended.
	Strong I.T knowledge and experience (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.
	Excellent Report Writing skills.
	Ability to meet deadline.
	High level of commitment, honesty and enthusiasm.
	Excellent problem-solving, analytical, skills.
	Excellent verbal, written communication and research skills.
	Ability to pay attention to detail.
	Excellent interpersonal skill.

title: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director (Male) Job at Human Capital Group
content:
Human Capital Group, a Financial Leasing Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director (Male)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Employment Type: Full-Time (Onsite)

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As the Executive Assistant to the Managing Director, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient operation of the executive office.
	You will be responsible for a wide range of tasks that require meticulous attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide comprehensive administrative support to the Managing Director, including managing calendars, scheduling meetings, and coordinating travel arrangements.
	Act as the primary point of contact between the Managing Director and internal/external stakeholders. Handle correspondence, draft emails, and manage communication flow.
	Conduct research and gather information to support decision-making processes. Provide analysis and summaries of key data.
	Coordinate company events, meetings, and conferences, ensuring all logistics are handled seamlessly.
	Organize and prepare for meetings, including drafting agendas, taking minutes, and following up on action items.
	Assist in the planning and execution of special projects, ensuring timely completion and alignment with company objectives.
	Prepare, review, and organize documents, reports, and presentations. Maintain accurate and organized records and filing systems.
	Handle confidential information with utmost discretion and professionalism.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field preferred.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Secretary, Personal Assistant etc preferably supporting senior executives.
	Exceptional organizational and time management skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Professional demeanor and ability to handle sensitive information with discretion.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humancapitalgroupng@gmail.com using "Executive Assistant to the Managing Director" as the subject of the mail.

title: Data Engineer Job at Dufil Group
content:
Dufil Group has had a remarkable impact on the Nigerian culinary Landscape. Their Product, Indomie Instant Noodles which appeals to several demographic groups has grown to become a household name across the country. The group, which is a joint venture between Tolaram Group of Singapore and Salim Group of Indonesia, currently has 3 factories. The First; De United Foods Industries limited which was commissioned in 1995 in Ota Ogun State, is the First Instant Noodles Manufacturing Plant in Nigeria and the Largest in Africa

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Engineer
Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our Data and Analytics  team.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in building and maintaining  scalable data pipelines, optimizing data flow, and working with various data infrastructure  technologies.
	This role is critical in ensuring the seamless integration and accessibility of  data across the organization, enabling data-driven decision making and insights.


Key Responsibilities


	Data Pipeline Development
	Data Integration and Management
	Data Quality and Governance
	Collaboration and Support
	Continuous Improvement.


Requirements / Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree  (First class Graduate) in Computer Science, Information Technology,  Engineering, or a related field.
	2+ years of experience in data engineering or related roles
	Master’s degree or relevant certification in data engineering, data  science, or big data technologies is a plus.
	Proven track record of designing and implementing data pipelines and  ETL processes.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
	Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g.,  MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra).
	Experience with data processing frameworks and tools such as Apache  Spark, Hadoop, or Kafka.
	Familiarity with cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google  Cloud) for data storage and processing.


Analytical Skills: 


	 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work with large datasets and perform data analysis to derive insights.


Soft Skills:


	Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage  multiple tasks effectively.


Note: Only successful applicants will be contacted.

title: HSE Manager Job at Human Capital Group
content:
Human Capital Group, a Financial Leasing Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Work mode: On Site

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop, implement, and maintain health, safety, and environmental policies and procedures in compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.
	Investigate accidents or incidents to determine causes and to find ways to prevent future occurrences.
	Undertake risk assessments
	Liaise with external HSE regulatory bodies and ensure compliance with local, state, and federal environmental, health, and safety regulations
	Ensure proper documentation of HSE-related activities and events
	Carry out safety induction and safety awareness for new joiners
	Conduct regular inspections and audits of facilities, equipment, and processes to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety standards.
	Coordinate emergency response plans and procedures, including drills and training for emergency response teams.
	Work with the Facility Managers in the disposal of hazardous waste following legal and environmental requirements
	Provide training and support to employees on safety protocols, procedures, and best practices.
	Monitor and analyze safety data and metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate safety and environmental considerations into planning and decision-making processes.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.
	Minimum of Four years of experience as an HSE Officer, or a similar role.
	Strong knowledge of health, safety, and environmental regulations and standards.
	Proven experience developing and implementing safety programs and initiatives.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with employees at all levels of the organization.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify risks and develop practical solutions.
	Certification in Occupational Health and Safety (e.g. HSE 123 NEBOSH, IOSH etc) will be an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humancapitalgroupng@gmail.com using "HSE Manager" as the subject of the mail.
